attributes.action: Prioritise Priority 2 cancer patients to have surgery ASAP
attributes.additional_details: The government must protect all cancer patients and their treatment, especially those whose prognosis depend on surgery. Priority two cancer surgeries must still go ahead and all cancelled operations given a new surgery date as soon as possible.
attributes.background: Kings College hospital has cancelled Priority 2 cancer operations. Priority 2 are deemed urgent and should be done within 28 days of discovery to ensure the cancer doesn’t spread and chances of survival can be maximised. Cancer patients are being left devastated by this news, with no surgery date.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552734

We can't accept petitions calling for changes to how individual NHS trusts make decisions about prioritising medical treatment, as this is matter for individual NHS trusts, not the Government or House of Commons.
